main event: On 5 July 1956, in Euclid, Ohio, there was a ground-visual observation of one circular object that appeared to be revolving and giving off a bluish-green light, drifting northeast at an altitude of 3 to 6 thousand feet.
interesting points: The object was observed to be revolving at a slow speed and appeared to be very brilliant.
The object rolled across a field toward the woods before disappearing into the tree tops.
This observation involved both civilian and military sources.
It was concluded that the object was possibly a balloon or possibly an aircraft.
There were ground visual and ground-radar sightings of the object.
sighted object: one circular object giving off a bluish-green light
